title: Change the priority of address bar autocomplete options
content: After a recent update, autocomplete seems to have shuffled the order of entries that show up. I used to type "g" in order to go to github.com, but now it leads me to git.net-core.org first. I have to finish typing the "l" or manually navigate to it in the address bar, and it breaks the workflow. I don't want to remove git.net-core from my history as I also need to visit it occasionally, but I want autocomplete to prioritize github.com over it. How would I go about accomplishing this?
creator: jackiecrazyhi

title: Clicking hyperlinks and embedded links sometimes hangs that particular tab for about 10 seconds before loading the site.
content:
Hello,

Sometimes, when I click an embedded/hyper link within Firefox, say I tried clicking a link provided after I google searched something, the tab itself would hang for 10 seconds before it would begin loading the site. When I say "hang", I mean that the entire tab becomes unresponsive to my clicks, I can't refresh the page, I couldn't change the address bar to a different link (it would allow me to manipulate the address bar, but the browser wouldn't reflect on that change, instead just going to the link I had clicked before the hang after the 10 second delay) and my mouse just stays as one sprite/disappears all together (when on the tab).

I find that this isn't a full browser issue as I can easily just start another tab and try there, but this issue is prevalent in that it randomly hangs any one tab I'm using for 10 seconds, and it's not just with Google.

I've identified that it isn't an extension issue or a different tab being used (tested in troubleshoot mode), nor an accessibility issue (as far as I know). I've disabled both my firewall and antivirus temporarily and it still occurred.

It's gotten in the way of a lot of work and I haven't been able to find anything regarding this exact problem on the support site. I've been dealing with it since my first installation of firefox (a few months ago).
creator: MrInsertName

title: An Auto Click for a webpage tab that I will not intrude on my cursor used for other tabsAn Auto Click for a webpage tab that I will not intrude on my cursor used for other tabs
content:
Im looking for an autoclicker extension, software, it can be JavaScript, but I need it to be where I just paste into the console of inspect element. Where it just requires me to move my mouse to the exact location. To lockdown the coordinates of where to autoclick on the tab that I am currently using. For this particular example it would be used on Facebook for clicking a button that horizontally scrolls more profiles of continuously until it reaches the end. However, I still want to be able to freely use my mouse on other tabs once I make this one no longer active. Without the fear of it no longer working due to being in the background, or by the autoclicking taking effect on where ever I position the mouse after

so if you have a JavaScript code that can do that great. Otherwise, please just suggest extensions, software, or etc that can do the job.

as previously stated I want to still be able to click, scroll or move my mouse on other tabs while the auto click is working on the selective tab. I do not want to have to relinquish control of my mouse until the procedure is done.

There is the auto clicker by murgee, that will do what I am requesting, but it requires a monthly subscription instead of a one time payment

Now if any of you require a one time payment for your extension, software, or whatever it is that you conjure to perform the request. I will be more then happy to oblige. I just cant do a monthly, or a yearly subscription, it needs to be a one time payment,

title: Maximising Firefox window "freezes" my laptop
content: Recently I have had multiple occurrences of Firefox "freezing" and I have to shutdown the browser which then reports the fault to Microsoft. It seems to happen when I click on the button to Maximise the browser window. I'm running Windows 11. It generally does restore the browser tabs successfully but is nevertheless irritating and a recent phenomenom.
creator: ecotree53
